724524f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Varick Street
724524f-a.text:
Houston Street, western section (formerly Hammersley Street), north
side, east from and including Varick Street. The one-story
garage with the sign ''Brakes,'' at 224-226 West Houston, is very
new, less than three years old as shown, replacing the old three-
story wagon shop which was once the Hammersley Iron Foundry.
The corner building, 206 Varick Street, was built since 1922,
replacing two frame houses, 230-232 West Houston Street.
May 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724524f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

724520f-b.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Varick Street
724520f-b.text:
(1)
218-216-214 West Houston Street, north side, east of Varick
Street: three houses dating back to the time of the Civil War,
but not much earlier. No. 216 has a passageway through it
from the street to the stables, which are in the rear.
The building adjoining them at the right is No. 206, as if these
three houses were numbered 218, 212, 208, respectively.
June 15, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A detail of 218-216e214 West ouston Street, the driveway through
No. 216, from the street to the stables in the rear of the
building. Compare 48-50 King Street, just east of the S.E.
corner of Varick Street.
June 23, 1930.
(PeLe eue2en e aieva'g)
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724520f-b.folder: Houston Street (West & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

724519f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Varick Street
724519f-a.text:
(1)
Stables of 214-216-218 West Houston Street, north side, east of
Varick Street. These stables are in the rear of the three
houses to which they belong, with a little cobble-stoned court-
yard in between. The dark body at the left is the rear of No.
214; and the view is west.
June 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Stables of 216-214 West Houston Street and the rear of No. 214
itself. The view is east, showing the stables at the left.
June 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A detail of the stable belonging to No. 216, the middle house.
June 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724519f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

723768f.title: Manhattan: Varick Street - Houston Street (West)
723768f.text:
(1)
207, 209 Varick Street and 244 West Houston Street, at and ad-
joining the N.W. corner.
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, also including 211 Varick Street and 246 West Houston
Street.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
723768f.folder: Varick Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY

723767f-a.title: Manhattan: Varick Street - Houston Street (West)
723767f-a.text:
Varick Street, east side, north from Wost Houston (right) to Downing
(left) Streets. Also shown is West Houston Street, at, adjoining and east of
the N.E. corner of Varick Street.
May 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723767f-a.folder: Varick Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY

719346f-a.title: Manhattan: Downing Street - Varick Street
719346f-a.text:
69 Downing Street, adjcining the N.E. corner of Varick Street, showing
the lower floors of a 2iW-story structure. The structures to the left
were demolished in 1915 when Varick Street was widened.
About 1914.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
719346f-a.folder: Downing Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

723769f-a.title: Manhattan: Varick Street - Houston Street
723769f-a.text:
207 to 225 Varick Street, west side, from Houston (formerly
Hammersley Street) to Clarkson Streets. All of these old houses,
except Nos. 223, 225, the two at the Clarkson Street end of the
block, are frame buildings faced with brick. They are shortly to
be demolished to make room for the Maltz Building.
June, 1925.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
723769f-a.folder: Varick Street & Houston Street, Manhattan, NY

724523f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Varick Street
724523f-a.text:
Houston Street, western section (formerly Hammersley Street), west
of, adjoining, and at Varick Street, view northeast. In the fore-
ground, on the south side, excavation for the future United States
Appraisers Stores Building is going on. On the north side may
be seen the eastern wing, 250 West Houston Street, of Public
School No. 95, and the south side of the new Malts BuildinE.
which replaced 248-242 West Houston Street and 207 to 225
Varick Street, the entire west side of the northernmost block.
December 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724523f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

719345f-a.title: Manhattan: Downing Street - Varick Street
719345f-a.text:
Downing Street, northeast from and including Varick Street.
The southwestern corner of the old Herring Farm, within which
lies all but the westernmost few feet of Downing Street, is
just off the picture to the right, the observer is standing in the
former Trinity Church Farm. Downing Street is the first of
seven streets laid out in the Herring Farm at right angles to
Bedford and Herring (now Bleecker) Streets.
The tall building on the horizon, seen down Downing Street,
is the One Fifth Avenue apartment hotel; a little to the right of
it the tower of the brand new Consolidated Gas Building, on East
14th Street, can be discerned.
September 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719345f-a.folder: Downing Street & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY

724522f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Varick Street
724522f-a.text:
222 to 200 West Houston Street (western section, formerly Hammersley
Street), north side, east of and from Varick Street. The roofs of
Nos. 58-46 Downing Street, on the south side of Downing, are shown
at the left.
In the left foreground of the picture we are looking down on the
old Hammersley Iron Foundry, originally 51-53 Hammersley Street
and 60 Downing Street; it extends through the block. The Houston
Street wing has been cut down from three-stories to one-story,
and the building made over into a garage.
The old boundary line between the Trinity Church Farm and the Herring
Farm runs along the backs of the Houston Street houses, dividing
the block. The Downing Street part of it, west to and including
No. 66 Downing Street, is all inside the old Herring Farm.
June 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724522f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Varick Street, Manhattan, NY
